story:
SweatBox (Design Patent Obtained - Utility Patent Pending) an innovative kinetically designed fitness training platform designed by Fitness Professionals for the purpose of performing Resistance (Anaerobic) Training Exercises and Cardio Conditioning (Aerobic) Exercises all on one piece of equipment without the burden of having to own various pieces of  gym equipment.  Its unique design targets the Core (Lumbo Pelvic Hip Complex) with every exercise performed.

 

 

SweatBox empowers people to get fit by creating an environment of anticipation, enthusiasm, creativity, and freedom through performing hundreds of resistance training exercises, which result in a healthier, happier, and longer life.              

SweatBox was designed and developed by personal trainers and coaches alike who understand how the body's systems react to different stressors placed on it through resistance training exercises. Combining various resistance training exercises into intervals, forming a circuit, is one of the most proven ways to get fit and healthy. 

Circuit Training focuses on both metabolic systems of the body, aerobic and anaerobic. By combining aerobic and anaerobic (resistance training) exercises into a circuit, it allows the body to burn the maximal amount of calories in the least amount of time. Furthermore, studies have shown that performing resistance training exercises (bodyweight anaerobic exercises) increases lean muscle mass. Lean muscle mass increases the body's metabolism and helps to reduce "Free Fatty Acids" in the blood stream that reap havoc on the body's metabolic systems. So if you're serious about wanting to better your physique and obtain a healthier body by improving your body's Physiological systems (muscular, nervous, cardiovascular, respiratory, skeletal, endocrine, and psychological), then the SweatBox is for you! 

The Core

The Core is the body’s foundation, center of gravity, and is where all movement originates. If you have a weak or dysfunctional core, then all other interconnected joints and muscles of your lower body (below the hip), and the upper body (above the hip), will have muscle imbalances which can result in improper movements and lead to injury. Therefore, it is imperative that you begin first with exercises that focus on training and strengthening the muscles of the “Lumbo Pelvic Hip Complex,” or core of the body. (The video below contains many core exercises) Note: The SweatBox used in this video is the ex-large version, but all exercises in this video can be performed on any size SweatBox.) 

 

About Us - SweatBox Team

Steve, the creator of SweatBox, is a Certified Personal Trainer (NASM), fitness coach, sports coach, and life coach who instructs clients in calisthenics, plyometrics, weight-lifting, athletic competition, high-Intensity circuit training, and nutrition. He creates fitness systems that educate, motivate, and instruct clients in reaching their fitness goals and full potential.

My team and I set out to design a fitness platform that would provide the exerciser a tool that would allow him or her to perform hundreds of different resistance training exercisers all on one piece of equipment without the burden of having to move around from one piece of equipment to another. SweatBox kinetically combines numerous pieces of gym equipment like the flat and incline bench, stair-master, plyobox, aerobic stepper, dip, and push-up station into one simple creative platform making it easy to obtain a full body workout. Furthermore, with the ability of the add-ons of the Resistance Bands and Parallette Bars, it provides the user the versatility of having a cable machine and parallel bars all in one piece of equipment. Another exciting benefit of the SweatBox's design is its innovative ability to be latched together as one solid box or unlatched into two separate individual platforms which allow for even more freedom of creating various calisthenic, plyometric, and resistance training exercises.  

Note: All SweatBoxes Pictured Below Are Prototypes: The logo will either be routed into the wood in place of the decals, or an engraved hard plastic or metal plate will be debossed into the Sweatbox. There will not be decals! 

(The Picture below shows the Sweatbox unlatched resulting in two separate platforms.) 

(The Picture below shows the SweatBox latched together resulting in one complete fitness platform.)  (Max Weight: 1 Person/250 lbs)

Why Does SweatBox Work? Understanding the Science Behind the Invention!

Exercise begins in the mind with knowledge, knowing how the body reacts to different stressors/resistance placed on it during exercise. This type of understanding will determine the person's percentage of success in fitness. Example: Two people take a twenty minute walk daily, one loses an average of 3 pounds per week while the other barely loses 1 pound per week. What's the difference? Speed? No! One understands how the body reacts to the different stressors placed on it during exercise and therefore incorporates resistance training exercises intermixed with his walking, while the other just walks, maintaining the same speed and heart rate through-out the entire walk.  

The overall objective/goal for a person when he or she exercises is to guard/maintain as much muscle as possible during exercise while burning the most fat. When a person performs long bouts of cardio exercises, the body enters into "guard mode," meaning that the body begins to use a percentage of muscle for energy as a way to preserve fat. 

The body is designed to predetermine what stressors are placed on it at all times for the purpose of protecting itself against injury and for survival. As soon as a person even begins to think of performing a single movement or exercise, the brain immediately begins to send messages/signals to the nervous system so it can begin to recruit the proper muscles in order to perform the movement. By doing this it prepares the body's muscles against an immediate shock or blow. (Note: This is why stretching is important before exercise.)   

When an exerciser maintains and builds muscle while at the same time maintaining an elevated heat rate, his or her body enters into a longer post exercise burn of energy which allows the body to continue to use more calories (some being from fat) as energy to repair the torn muscle fibers. This should be the goal of every exerciser who is looking to improve his or her health and get fit. (This is why bodybuilders have to consume more protein in order to maintain their physique and even more if they are wanting to build more muscle, to rebuild the torn muscle fibers.) 

So What's The Secret?

The secret, which has been out for many years, thanks to science and sports medicine, is to create an exercise routine that maintains and builds muscle, all the while burning fat. This is accomplished by performing resistance training exercises intermixed with cardio, which is why the SweatBox was created with its unique design. It provides the user an innovative tool to perform bodyweight resistance training exercises that maintain and build muscle while also providing a platform that allows for a mix-in of cardio to burn fat. Maintaining the heart rate in the appropriate zone for the appropriate amount of time will produce the results the exerciser is looking for.         

(Note: Results will vary depending on a person's HR - Heart Rate and physical condition!) Heart Rate is determined by age, weight, gender, health condition, medication, caffeine and alcohol consumption, diet, and sleep.  (Note: See your doctor before beginning and performing any exercise program!)

Benefits of SweatBox

  • Creates an environment of anticipation, enthusiasm, creativity, and freedom which results in greater success and longevity in fitness.
  • Provides a platform for performing resistance training exercises (anaerobic) that increase lean muscle mas and cardio exercises (aerobic) to get the user fit and healthy.    
  • Challenges the "Fitness Status Quo" by allowing "freedom in exercise!" Create/Invent your own resistance exercises and routines.
  • Multiple pieces of gym equipment designed into one innovative fitness platform/tool.  
  • Maintenance-free piece of equipment - no moving parts.
  • Latches together to form one solid platform.
  • Unlatches into two separate platforms allowing for even hundreds more of resistance training exercises.
  • Comes apart which makes it mobile friendly. Move it from room to room in your house, take it outside, to the park, beach, anywhere you go! (Fits in most car trunks)  
  • Resistance Bands Attachments Package (Add-on) for Building Muscles for all Muscle Groups of the Body. 
  • Parallette Bars (Add-on) for performing even more Stabilization and Body Weight Resistance Training Exercises.
  • Perfect for performing Intervals and Circuit Training.
  • It's the real deal! Not a fitness gimmick like so many products on the market today, it requires time and effort to see results. 
  • Perform (4) (20 Minute Workouts) per week for 6-8 Weeks coupled with a healthy diet to transform your body. It will get you fit!
  • Provides a fun way to workout due to the unlimited amount of exercises the user can perform! 
  • It's Simplistic: Crank up your favorite tunes and hit the box! It's that simple!    

Versatility/Mobility

The versatility of the SweatBox being mobile is very important as it allows the exerciser to take the SweatBox to different locations inside the house and outdoors, like to the park, beach, or on a trip allowing him or her to change up the environment of the workout. Studies show that changing up the fitness environment increases his or her percentage of successfully completing a workout and the longevity of the fitness program meaning that he or she will stick with it longer. Sticking with a fitness regimen on a consistent basis is the challenge and key to seeing positive results.     

For All Fitness Levels

Not only is the SweatBox a serious piece of equipment that provides the exerciser the ability to get into top shape, but it is very fun to use because of its versatility and variety of resistance exercises. Whether the person is a beginner or expert, SweatBox will challenge his or her level of fitness! SweatBox gives the user the power to get fit and intensify his or her workouts because of it's innovative design.     

Due Diligence

With two years in the making and six prototypes later, I believe our team (SweatBoxTeam)  has done it! All prototypes have been tested and used by common everyday people, fitness clients, fitness coaches, and personal trainers to be sure SweatBox produces the expected results. Please support our exciting campaign as this is only the beginning of many more innovative products to come! 

It's not just about the money, but integrity!

Many fitness companies and manufacturers do not have your best interest in mind. It's more about the money than creating a quality product that actually benefits you. We are bombarded daily by so many fitness gadgets and gimmicks which makes it hard to clearly understand which product will actually benefit us in helping produce results. The truth is, getting healthy and fit, feeling and looking good, only come by a combination of practicing proper nutrition and applying effort in exercise daily in one's life. It's impossible to "out exercise" junk food and excessive calories no matter what exercise apparatus you use and claims companies make. With that said, we, the SweatBox Team, are not going to make the false claim that if you just step up onto the box for 10 minutes a day you'll lose all that fat and transform your body! Anything that has value requires effort and an investment of time. Getting healthy requires effort, persistence, consistency, and a daily healthy diet. No More Excuses - get fit!   

How do you know if a fitness product is a gimmick?

The general rule of thumb is if a fitness product is promoted as not requiring much physical effort and time, then it is probably a gimmick and too good to be true. Furthermore, without physical effort, the most important element for the purpose of fitness, is left out of the equation which is to challenge and increase the heart rate resulting in engaging the body's Physiological  Systems - muscular, nervous, cardiovascular, respiratory, skeletal, endocrine, immune, and psychological. This is what leads to a healthy body.

There’s No Such Thing as “Spot Fat Loss”

 

Being Healthy and Fit Begins on the Inside!

A good looking, healthy and fit body begins from the inside out, beginning with the body's Physiological Systems of the body, then the core muscles (which are all muscles associated with the Lumbo Pelvic Hip Complex) and finally the muscle groups that make up the lower and upper extremities of the body. Take the easy way out focusing on just the outside-the body's appearance, and you are only applying a band-aid, a temporally fix, and not engaging the operating systems of the body that get you healthy. You are cheating yourself!  

SweatBox provides a fitness platform that focuses on one of the most important parts of the body, the core. The body's core (muscles associated with the Lumbo Pelvic Hip Complex) is the body's foundation and is where all movement begins. Body weight resistance training exercises like Push-Ups, Isometric and Dynamic Planks, V-Sit, L-Sit, Raised Leg Lifts, Dynamic Crunches, Mountain Climbers, and many others focus on strengthening the body's core. When your core is healthy and strong, it allows you to have even greater success performing exercise and lowers the percentage rate of injury during exercise and physical activty.            

Activity and exercise are not a choice! 

Studies have shown that most chronic diseases are associated with inactivity and a lack of exercise in one's life. Bottom line: The human body was designed to move, not sit all day. With the growth of technology racing off the charts and the ever increasing digital world in which we live, it has become even more challenging to get our bodies moving. The new "smoking can be hazardous to your health" is now "sitting!" Studies have shown that sitting for long periods on a consistent basis without movement is dangerous to our health and can actually lower a person's lifespan. It's like a car engine that just sits for days and weeks without use. The human body must be challenged to move in order to engage one of the most important muscles in the body, the heart. When the body moves, it causes the body's systems (physiological systems - muscular, nervous, cardiovascular, respiratory, skeletal, immune, endocrine, and psychological) to engage and respond, thus causing them to work as they are designed. Therefore, if you desire a healthy and fit body, longevity, and want to be around for a while for your family, then re-prioritize your life and incorporate one of the most important responsibilities into your daily schedule, exercise! Your life depends on it!

Don't Be a Statistic!

Over 70% of adults 20 years of age or older in the US are either overweight or obese - wow!​​​According to the CDC - Chronic Diseases such as obesity, diabetes, heart disease, and cancer are the leading cause of death. In 2012, almost half of the US population of adults had at least one chronic disease - about 117 million adults.  Additionally, 1 out of every 4 adults had two or more chronic diseases. One-third of adults, about 78 million, are considered to be obese - 30 pounds or more over the recommended weight for their height. It's time to take action before you become a statistic! It's serious!

Inactivity is your enemy, not activity and exercise! Inactivity leads to a lack of energy which leads to laziness which results in even more laziness. It's a downward spiral effect that has to be reversed, and can only come through activity. So get off the couch, turn off the television or gaming device, and get your exercise on the SweatBox so you can begin reversing the Inactivity Lazy Syndrome. 

Who's got time for the gym in these crazy days we live? 

You can ask anyone and almost always get the same answer...How are you doing today? Oh, I'm okay, but super busy! The question is...who's not busy these days?

With the time demands that gyms require like preparing your gym clothes, driving to and from the gym, working out, and then maybe even showering afterward and dressing, many people do not have the time to fulfill a gym membership.

SweatBox with its innovative design, provides the user a tool to empower him or her to perform hundreds of resistance training exercises coupled with aerobic cardio movements to get him or her healthy and fit! it's time to "step outside the box" and experience fitness in a new way, SWEATBOX!     

Is performing cardio exercises enough?

Performing cardio exercises, even though it will condition the cardiovascular, respiratory, and the other systems of the body, will only help a little with maintaining the body's muscle. Tests show that after an average of about 20 minutes of cardio exercise, the body begins to burn close to an equal percentage of muscle for energy as it does fat. Therefore, the overall objective during exercise is to build muscle while burning fat as we need to hold on to as much lean muscle mass as possible. Furthermore, it has been proven that as the body increases in lean muscle mass, it begins to burn more calories, which is required to repair the torn muscle fibers. Therefore, the body enters into a longer post calorie burn which should be the goal for anyone who is looking to get healthy and drop some pounds.  

Additionally, as one enters into his or her 30's he or she begins to lose an average of up to 10% of his or her muscle mass every year. Therefore, resistance training must be incorporated into one's life and begin to be part of his or her daily routine.      

 SWEATBOX Story

In January of 2015 my team and I set out to design an innovative fitness platform that would challenge the "fitness status quo" and allow the exerciser the freedom to perform hundreds of resistance training exercises all on one kinetically engineered platform without the burden of having to own multiple pieces of gym equipment. Additionally, we wanted the product to be free from moving parts so that no maintenance would be required saving the consumer even more money.

SweatBox solves the frustrating and annoying problem of having to spend thousands of dollars for fitness equipment, maintenance, and then find a place to store them. Furthermore, it provides freedom for the exerciser to create his or her own movements and routines, therefore making the exercise experience adventurous and fun!  

The Impact

By supporting this SweatBox campaign you will provide the necessary resources to allows us, the SweatBox Team, to bring the SweatBox, along with its many accessories, fitness videos, and information to production, thus providing the opportunity for many people to get fit, healthy, and experience a new life.  

The human body was designed for movement; therefore, we must create exciting fitness tools that will encourage and motivate people to move daily on a regular basis resulting in a healthy, fit, and good looking body. The SweatBox Fitness Platform was designed with this in mind and is the perfect tool to help people obtain their fitness goals. 

With your support, you will be joining the SweatBox Team in launching the SweatBox into production and allowing us to get this innovative fitness tool to the world. Furthermore, this will allow us to continue in our mission of creating and developing more innovative fitness products that will encourage people to exercise, get healthy and fit, and experience a new life through performing resistance training exercises.  

OUR PASSION

We love to see people overcome obstacles and reach their fitness goals and full potential in all areas of their lives.

OUR MISSION

To design innovative fitness tools that create an environment of empowerment, anticipation, enthusiasm, creativity, and longevity that will encourage more people to exercise which will result in a healthier, fitter, and happier life by performing resistance training exercises.             

OUR VISION

To create an entirely new fitness experience using the SweatBox called SweatBotics. SweatBotics is taking resistance training exercises intertwined with dancing and performing them in robotic type form on the SweatBox thus creating an entirely new fitness experience. 

When the body's muscles are challenged during movement (during the range of motion) to  stop at the beginning, middle, and end of an exercise, it causes the nervous system to have to recruit even more muscle fibers in order to perform the function. By doing this it places more stressors on the muscles, and the result is healthier, stronger, muscles. When combined with several dance moves, it's a combined resistance training and cardio workout that literal gets you excited, healthy, and fit to say the least!

Just imagine you're in a dark room, the dance lights come on, the music ignites, and the instructor steps up on the SweatBox along with the other dozen exercisers, and the workout begins! Everyone performs SweatBotics to the beat. Wow, now that's what I'm talking about!

Please join our team by choosing a perk and help us take the first step in making this vision a reality! Thank you!   

          

SWEATBOX - TIMELINE

1. January 2015: Conception of Idea

2. January - March 2015: Sketch and rough draft

3. March - May 2015: Research and test the size and heights of each level of the SweatBox

4. May, 2015 - April 2016: Study and research patent process

5. May 2015: Brainstorm a name for the exercise platform

After brainstorming and considering many different names, we chose the name "SweatBox" as it was a perfect fit for how we wanted to describe and people to perceive the invention.

6. May - June 2015: Re-sketch and draft drawings with measurements for the platform's size and dimensions

We made some final sketches using what we believed to be the perfect dimensions for the first SweatBox.

7. July 2015: Build a physical model, 3D prototype

We built the first 3D prototype out of Styrofoam to get a visual of the size and measurements so we would not have to waste money using more expensive materials like wood, plastic, or metal.

8. July - August 2015: Built a working prototype to test the functionality of the platform

 

First SweatBox Prototype. 39 inches length x 44 inches wide   

9. July - September 2015: Patent Search

10. September - November 2015: Draft of professional drawings of the platform for a design patent and possible provisional patent

11. December 2015 - May 2016: Continue research on the design of the platform, prior art patent searches, and begin drafting information on design and provisional patents for the SweatBox.

12. June - August 2016: Research manufacturers and began the communication process

13. July 2016: Filed with a patent attorney the design patent application for the resistance training exercise platform

14. July 2016: Built an improved prototype

 Second SweatBox Prototype

We built an even better SweatBox prototype out of wood material. We continued to test this model and began circuit training on it. This was exciting as it provided the results we were hoping for.

15. August 2016: Enter into agreement with manufacturer to render engineering drawings and design two prototypes 

16. August 2016: Review and revise engineer drawings for two prototypes to be manufactured.

17. August - September 2016: Gather and write the description, drawings, and information needed for the provisional patent and file

18. September 2016 - February, 2017: Prepare for crowd funding campaign on Indiegogo

19. November 2016: Received prototypes from manufacturer...not satisfied with the delivered product.  

20. November 2016: Begin search for another manufacturer.  

21. December 2016: Add to the SweatBox Team.

22. January 2017: Build another prototype to calculate material costs and labor   

                      

                        Size: 42 inches in width x 37 inches in length - reduced the size from the first one.                                    

Our team built another prototype in order to calculate material and labor costs. We are leaning towards setting up shop and manufacturing the SweatBox ourselves.

During the process our team added the option of resistance bands: Wow -  what an amazing add-on! 

23. January - May 2017: Continue to add to and build the SweatBox Team.

24. March - June 2017: Prepare for videos and photos of the SweatBox prototype; begin shooting videos and taking photos for the story line of the SweatBox.

25. April - June 2017: Research manufacturers for resistance bands

26. June 2017: Create prototype of Parallette Bars.

 

27. May - June 2017: Test Resistance Bands and Parallette Bars

28. July 2017: Overcome Obstacles - Shipping: 1. Too much money to ship Sweatbox as one piece and not mobile friendly. 2. Too complicated for consumer to assemble. 

29. July - August 2017: Overcame Obstacles: New engineer drawings for split model; Built new prototype to be tested. Latches and unlatches together. Now two SweatBoxes in one with even more opportunities for exercise! Reduced the size again: New Size: 32 inches in width x 37 inches in length. The two individual 16 x 37 inch platforms come together to form One Solid SWEATBOX. Obstacles can be opportunities! Exciting! 

 Now can be affordably shipped and is mobile friendly! (Shipped as shown below)

         

SweatBox prototype which was used for testing the structure and functionality of the platform. Note: When SweatBox goes into production, the logo will either be routed into the wood or a rectangular logo plate will be made from either hard plastic or rubber material then fastened into a 2/16 inch routed space in place of the decals. (Decals were used only for the prototype.)  

30. June - August 2017: Continue preparing for the launch of the crowdfunding campaign: Indiegogo

31. September - October 2017: Launch exciting, innovative SweatBox Fitness Platform Campaign on Indiegogo fundraising platform.

32. October - November 2017: Reach Our Goal: Hopefully, God willing, we will reach our goal on the Indiegogo fundraising platform and begin manufacturing the exciting innovative SweatBox Fitness Product.

33. November 2017 through May 2018: Manufacture SweatBoxes for all backers and fulfill all perks. 

34. 2018 and Forward: Continue to improve, manufacture, and sell SweatBoxes.

35. 2018 -2019 - SweatBotics: Begin promoting and training for "SweatBotics Group Fitness Classes in USA. Train Fitness Coaches to lead SweatBotics Classes. Licensing, Etc. 

36. 2018 - 2019: Begin manufacturing prototypes of our other exciting, innovative fitness products that will re-revolutionize the fitness industry. Can't wait - Bring it! Our goal: Make exercise an EVENT! Get excited about it!

We're excited! The possibility of creating fitness products that will encourage and provide a tool for more people to get fit and improve their health, give them longevity, and experience a new life, while allowing existing exercise practitioners to intensify their training and results and reach new levels, is extremely exciting for our team.

Make exercise an EVENT - get excited about it! No More Excuses!

Please support our campaign and be one of the first to get your own SWEATBOX by choosing one of our exciting perks! By choosing a perk this will provide us the necessary resources to begin production of the SWEATBOX and get this innovative product out to the world! Get excited!

Follow us here...subscribe for our newsletter! https://www.sweatbox1.com/sweat

 

What We Need & What You Get

When you support and back our SWEATBOX campaign, not only will you receive an innovative SweatBox for performing hundreds of resistance training exercises, but you will also be joining the SweatBox community by taking part in bringing the SweatBox to production, which will provide many people a unique fitness tool that will encourage them to lose weight, get healthy and fit! 

Our Goal: To create, design and produce innovative high quality products that are unque, challenge the "Stauts-Quo," encourage and empower people to get fit and healthy. We would rather produce a high quality product that costs a little more to manufacture, than an inexpensive cheap product that will not last. For us, it's about quality and integrity, not just about the numbers. Our product needs to be a win-win, which means a durable quality product priced fairly for our backers (fitness family), but at a price that will allow our team to launch the business successfully and not go broke in the process.

Another one of our main goals is to challenge the "fitness status quo" by designing unique quality products that create an environment of anticipation, enthusiasm, creativity, and freedom which results in greater success by allowing the exerciser to experience freedom in exercise. We want to move from fitness being just fitness, to fitness being an "experience!" That's another reason why the SweatBox was created with its innovative kinetic design, to give people a new and exciting experience!   

Our goal is set for $50,000.00 in order to bring the SweatBox into production. This is the breaking point for maintaining the cost of materials at a fairly affordable price. But if we can reach beyond the set goal then we will be well on our way as this will give us the proper amount of resources to position us for even greater success and produce the SweatBox at an even lower price which can be passed on to our community.     

Risks & Challenges

With over two years of time invested, 6 prototypes, hundreds of hours of research and development, tests, patents pending, and many dollars invested into the SweatBox, we really need to hit our goal so we can take SweatBox to the next level, which is production. It needs to be CNC precisioned cut, and our proprietary parts need to be manufactured.

If we do not hit our goal then we will be at risk of losing the opportunity of bringing the SweatBox to production, not finishing the patents, and going broke, which would be devastating considering the amount of resources we have invested in the project over the last two years. But even the saddest part I believe would be that no one would ever be able to experience the exciting innovative SweatBox for him or herself.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please join our team in getting the word out about the SweatBox! Please share this campaign with all of your family, friends, co-workers, and with all of your social media platforms. Tag us when you share it and if we hit our goal we'll send you a SweatRag w/logo and WristBand, just pay $5.00 shipping. (Fulfilled after goal is hit and within 60 days after funds are received from Indiegogo!) Indiegogo made it easy to share by using their "Share Tools!" You must use the share tools in order to qualify for your SweatRag and WristBand Reward! 

Size & Weight 

  • Together as one box: 37 inches in length x 32 inches in width
  • Separates into two separate individual platforms:  37 inches in length x 16 inches in width 
  • Height of highest level - 15 inches
  • Height of lowest level - 7 inches
  • Incline level: Begins at the 7 inch height to adjoining 15 inch height
  • Together as one box SweatBox weighs approximately 76lbs - this is necessary as the platform must be very stable.
  • Each individual platform weighs approximately 38 lbs. Because the weight is equally distributed it does not feel very heavy when picked up with two hands making it mobile friendly. (Max Weight: 1 Person/275 lbs)

Manufacturing

  • SweatBox is made from Grade A treated 3/4 inch plywood 
  • CNC machined cut for precise fit
  • Internal cross frame for extra support
  • Pre-drilled holes
  • All joints wood glued together to create one solid box 
  • Held together by wood screws
  • Top surface covered with 3/16 thickness interwoven fabric rubber material and bonded to wood with industrial cement.   
  • Heavy duty latches in front and back
  • Corners and edges rounded for safety  
  • Bottom of box - non skid gripper strippers

Note: The logo will either be routed into the wood in place of the decals, or an engraved hard plastic or metal plate will be debossed into the SweatBox.

Note: The Parallette Bars will be machined shaped and not have joints as seen in the prototype picture.
